text: date: sun, 21 nov 1999 23:28:41 -0500 from: "jason lopp" (jlopp@bgnet.bgsu.edu)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: nbc: y2k moviewith regard to "a true y2k disaster: the movie," 20.nov.1999,i agree with the stance on this movie. i particularly liked how most of the computers and/or equipment were notdate dependent, or didn't make sense being date dependent.for instance, the first disaster that struck atmidnight. can't forget that f-18 that crashed in the marshall islands. the first question i thought "how stupid isthat! why would an f-18 fighter plane have a date dependent process that would cause it to malfunction in year2000?" a lot of that movie was just that, computers crashing for the sake of making something interestinghappen. this made me very irritable knowing that this was aired; even though most of the computers thatcrashed did so not because of what y2k is actually about.
